snippet: Territory officials are crying foul over Prime Minister David Cameron’s plan to impose a 15 percent tax on residents of Britain who place bets on any of Gibraltar’s Internet gambling sites.
abstract: Officials and executives in British territory Gibraltar are crying foul over Prime Minister David Cameron's plan to impose 15 percent tax on residents of Britain who place bets on dozens of online gambling sites; people say it is unfair revenue grab by London government for territory that has significant autonomy over trade and industry issues.
lead_paragraph: Territory officials are crying foul over Prime Minister David Cameron’s plan to impose a 15 percent tax on residents of Britain who place bets on any of Gibraltar’s Internet gambling sites.

headline.main: British Plan on Taxing Gambling Annoys Many in Gibraltar
headline.print_headline: British Plan on Taxing Gambling Annoys Many in Gibraltar
